problem.markdown:
Which of the following is true about SketchPad and Dan's example of "newCounter"? ( ) SketchPad is a worse example of OOP than newCounter ( ) SketchPad is a better example of OOP than newCounter (x) SketchPad and newCounter both are based on a prototyping method ( ) None of the above ( ) All of the above
[explanation] Both SketchPad and newCounter are very clear example of OOP, because they both are based on a protoyping method, i.e. where there exists a 'master' and a 'clone'. [explanation]
problem.p: Which of the following is true about SketchPad and Dan's example of "newCounter"?

choicegroup.choice: SketchPad is a worse example of OOP than newCounter
SketchPad is a better example of OOP than newCounter
SketchPad and newCounter both are based on a prototyping method

div.p: Both SketchPad and newCounter are very clear example of OOP, because they both are based on a protoyping method, i.e. where there exists a 'master' and a 'clone'.
